title: Mussels with Garlic and White Wine
introduction: Mussels with Garlic and White Wine is a simple yet sophisticated dish that highlights the natural brininess of fresh mussels combined with the aromatic richness of garlic and herbs. This dish can be enjoyed on its own with toasted bread or mixed into hot cooked spaghetti for a more substantial meal. Perfect for seafood lovers, this recipe is sure to impress with its flavorful elegance.
instructions: Soak the mussels in cold water for 30 minutes. Cut or pull off the beards. Discard any mussels with cracked shells or that do not close tightly when touched.
Pour the olive oil into a large saucepan. Add the garlic, green onions, thyme, parsley, and bay leaf. Cook over medium heat until the onions are tender, about 2 minutes.
Add the mussels and wine. Cover and cook, shaking the pan occasionally, about 5 minutes or until the mussels begin to open.

Transfer the opened mussels to individual serving bowls. Cook any mussels that remain closed a minute or two longer; discard any that do not open. Simmer the liquid for 1 minute more and pour it over the mussels. Serve hot with toasted bread.
variations: Instead of serving with bread, toss the mussels with hot cooked spaghetti.
Small hard-shell clams can be substituted for mussels.
